verses.verse: Thus the Lord <WH136> Jehovah <WH136> showed <WH7200> me <WH3619>: and, behold, a basket of summer fruit <WH7019>.

And he said <WH559>, Amos <WH5986>, what seest <WH7200> thou <WH559>? And I said, A basket <WH3619> of summer fruit <WH7019>. Then said <WH559> Jehovah <WH3068> unto me <WH7093>, The end is come <WH935> upon my people <WH5971> Israel <WH3478>; I will not again <WH3254> pass by them any more <WH5674>.

And the songs <WH7892> of the temple <WH1964> shall be wailings <WH3213> in that day <WH3117>, saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> Jehovah <WH3069>: the dead bodies <WH6297> shall be many <WH7227>: in every place <WH4725> shall they cast them forth <WH7993> with silence <WH2013>.
Hear <WH8085> this <WH7602>, O ye that would swallow up the needy <WH34>, and cause <WH7673> the poor <WH6041> of the land <WH776> to fail <WH7673>,

saying <WH559>, When will the new moon <WH2320> be gone <WH5674>, that we may sell <WH7666> grain <WH7668>? and the sabbath <WH7676>, that we may set forth <WH6605> wheat <WH1250>, making the ephah <WH374> small <WH6994>, and the shekel <WH8255> great <WH1431>, and dealing falsely <WH5791> with balances <WH3976> of deceit <WH4820>;
that we may buy <WH7069> the poor <WH1800> for silver <WH3701>, and the needy <WH34> for a pair of shoes <WH5275>, and sell <WH7666> the refuse <WH4651> of the wheat <WH1250>?
Jehovah <WH3068> hath sworn <WH7650> by the excellency <WH1347> of Jacob <WH3290>, Surely I will never <WH5331> forget <WH7911> any of their works <WH4639>.

Shall not the land <WH776> tremble <WH7264> for this <WH56>, and every one mourn that dwelleth <WH3427> therein <WH5927>? yea, it shall rise up wholly like the River <WH2975>; and it shall be troubled <WH1644> and sink <WH8257> again <WH216>, like the River of Egypt <WH4714>.

And it shall come to pass in that day <WH3117>, saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> Jehovah <WH3069>, that I will cause the sun <WH8121> to go down <WH935> at noon <WH6672>, and I will darken <WH2821> the earth <WH776> in the clear <WH216> day <WH3117>.

And I will turn <WH2015> your feasts <WH2282> into mourning <WH60>, and all your songs <WH7892> into lamentation <WH7015>; and I will bring <WH5927> sackcloth <WH8242> upon all loins <WH4975>, and baldness <WH7144> upon every head <WH7218>; and I will make <WH7760> it as the mourning <WH60> for an only <WH3173> son <WH319>, and the end thereof as a bitter <WH4751> day <WH3117>.

Behold <WH3117>, the days come <WH935>, saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> Jehovah <WH136>, that I will send <WH7971> a famine <WH7458> in the land <WH776>, not a famine <WH7458> of bread <WH3899>, nor a thirst <WH6772> for water <WH4325>, but of hearing <WH8085> the words <WH1697> of Jehovah <WH3068>.

And they shall wander <WH5128> from sea <WH3220> to sea <WH3220>, and from the north <WH6828> even to the east <WH4217>; they shall run to and fro <WH7751> to seek <WH1245> the word <WH1697> of Jehovah <WH3068>, and shall not find it <WH4672>.
In that day <WH3117> shall the fair <WH3303> virgins <WH1330> and the young men <WH970> faint <WH5968> for thirst <WH6772>.

They that swear <WH7650> by the sin <WH819> of Samaria <WH8111>, and say <WH559>, As thy god <WH430>, O Dan <WH1835>, liveth <WH2416>; and <WH1870>, As the way of Beer-sheba <WH884> liveth <WH2416>; they shall fall <WH5307>, and never rise up again <WH6965>.
